actions: This is the state of game from your (potentially-limited) perspective contained between <state> and </state>.

action_select: This is the state of game from your (potentially-limited) perspective contained between <state> and </state>.
Based on your understanding of the rules, predict what your available actions are.
Write exactly the number of the action you are taking.
self_eval: This is the state of game from your (potentially-limited) perspective contained between <state> and </state>.
Write the action you are taking.
Is this a good action? yes/no.
others: This is the state of game from your (potentially-limited) perspective contained between <state> and </state>.
Based on your understanding of the rules, predict precisely what actions other players (both opponents and teammates, if applicable) might take during or after your turn.
state: This is the state of game from your (potentially-limited) perspective contained between <state> and </state>.
This turn, you are taking the following action:
During or after this turn, other players will do the following:

goal: This is the state of game from your (potentially-limited) perspective contained between <state> and </state>.
Will you eventually win from this position? yes/no
terminal: Write {who} observation of the state contained between <state> and </state>.
